page.title: 03 SWINNEY ENGINEERING LTD.
page.content: In 1866 the{Swinney Brothers}from Berwick took over the old Tanners' Yard in the centre of Morpeth for an iron foundry, turning out in the early days anything the area required.{ {Chantry (1869) and Skinnery (1904) {bridges}were built by{Swinney's}and as the firm grew it extended into more specialized work for the{SHIPBUILDING} industry.At the present time Swinney's are specialists in the design and manufacture of Filtration and Separation equipment for{OIL, GAS}and{ {CHEMICAL}installations. The existing site no longer allows for expansion so Swinney's,still a family firm,will move in the near future to Ashington taking with them the existing work force and also employing extra labour. The vacated site will be used for a supermarket and car park giving new employment and bringing trade.
